title: How to Check if a Hard Drive is an SSD or HDD on a Windows PC

steps.title: Press Ctrl+⇧ Shift+Esc.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + ⇧ Shift + Esc . This opens the Task Manager. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select the Performance tab.
steps.content: Select the Performance tab. You'll see this at the top of the window on Windows 10. If you're using Windows 11, it'll be the second icon from the top on the left column. [2] X Research source This displays a list of your computer's hardware including CPUs, memory, and drives.

steps.title: Locate your drives.
steps.content: Locate your drives. Your PC's drives will likely be labeled as Disk 0 , Disk 1 , etc. Under the name and letter of each hard drive, you'll see if it's a HDD, an SSD, or a removable drive such as a USB flash drive. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the Windows Search bar.
steps.content: Open the Windows Search bar. Click the magnifying glass located on the left-hand side of your toolbar. [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Type optimize.
steps.content: Type optimize . A list of matching results will appear. We want Defragment and Optimize Drives . [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Defragment and Optimize Drives.
steps.content: Click Defragment and Optimize Drives . It should be the first search result. This opens the Optimize Drives panel.

steps.title: Find your drive type under “Media Type".
steps.content: Find your drive type under “Media Type". You'll see either "Solid state drive" or "Hard drive" under "Media Type." If you have more than one drive in the computer, they'll each be listed separately.

steps.title: Open the Windows Search bar.
steps.content: Open the Windows Search bar. Click the magnifying glass located on the left-hand side of your toolbar. [6] X Research source Using the Device Manager to determine your hard drive type can be useful if you are curious about your storage size and type as well.

steps.title: Type device manager.
steps.content: Type device manager . Select Device Manager from the given results. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the drop-down arrow next to "Disk Drives".
steps.content: Click the drop-down arrow next to "Disk Drives". This will reveal your computer's hard drives. You will see either SSD or HDD in each drive's name.

steps.title: Open the Windows Search bar.
steps.content: Open the Windows Search bar. Click the magnifying glass located on the left-hand side of your toolbar.

steps.title: Type PowerShell.
steps.content: Type PowerShell . Select Windows PowerShell from the given results.

steps.title: Type Get-PhysicalDisk .
steps.content: Type Get-PhysicalDisk . This will pull up a chart displaying the physical disk drives installed on your PC. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Find your drive type under "MediaType".
steps.content: Find your drive type under "MediaType". The MediaType column will read either HDD or SSD for each of your hard drives. [9] X Research source
